stakeholders.name: Recently laid-off individuals
stakeholders.interests: Financial survival, wealth preservation, emotional support

stakeholders.name: Families/dependents
stakeholders.interests: Financial stability, emotional support, future security

stakeholders.name: Investment platforms
stakeholders.interests: Asset growth, user acquisition, market share

stakeholders.name: Government unemployment agencies
stakeholders.interests: Economic stability, employment rates, social welfare

workflows_and_processes: Job loss occurs → panic and emotional stress
Immediate financial assessment → often incomplete or inaccurate
Job search begins → often unfocused and inefficient
Financial guidance sought → usually generic advice or expensive advisors
Investment decisions → usually paused or abandoned
existing_feedback_mechanisms: Generic financial apps (not tailored to unemployment)

resource_flows.attention: Scattered across multiple platforms and resources
resource_flows.trust: Low due to financial stress and uncertainty

bottlenecks_and_pain_points: Lack of specialized guidance for unemployment scenarios
High cost of professional financial advice
No integrated approach to unemployment financial management

critical_variables.pattern: High during unemployment, decreases with guidance
Decreases with withdrawals, increases with continued contributions
Depletes during unemployment, rebuilds with new job
Low during crisis, improves with guidance

patterns_identified: Growth: User confidence, investment knowledge, financial stability
Decay: 401K balance (if withdrawals), emergency fund, job search motivation
Oscillation: User stress levels, engagement with app
Stability: Long-term wealth building (with proper guidance)

reinforcing_loops.name: Financial Confidence Loop
reinforcing_loops.description: Better guidance → increased confidence → better decisions → better outcomes → more trust in guidance → better guidance

reinforcing_loops.name: Wealth Building Loop
reinforcing_loops.description: Continued investing → portfolio growth → increased confidence → more investing → portfolio growth

reinforcing_loops.name: Community Support Loop
reinforcing_loops.description: Active community → shared experiences → emotional support → increased engagement → more active community

reinforcing_loops.name: Job Search Success Loop
reinforcing_loops.description: Better financial stability → less stress → better job search performance → faster re-employment → better financial stability

balancing_loops.name: Resource Depletion Loop
balancing_loops.description: 401K withdrawals → reduced retirement savings → increased future financial stress → need for more withdrawals

balancing_loops.name: App Abandonment Loop
balancing_loops.description: Re-employment → reduced financial stress → decreased app usage → loss of financial discipline → potential future problems

balancing_loops.name: Market Volatility Loop
balancing_loops.description: Market downturns → portfolio losses → increased stress → panic decisions → more losses

system_archetypes.name: Limits to Growth
system_archetypes.description: App growth limited by user lifecycle (unemployment is temporary)

system_archetypes.name: Shifting the Burden
system_archetypes.description: Quick fixes (401K withdrawals) vs. fundamental solutions (continued investing)

system_archetypes.name: Success to the Successful
system_archetypes.description: Users who get good guidance early succeed more than those who don't

high_impact_leverage_points.name: Early intervention point
high_impact_leverage_points.description: Catching users immediately after job loss, before panic decisions
high_impact_leverage_points.impact: Prevents costly mistakes, builds trust early

high_impact_leverage_points.name: 401K guidance point
high_impact_leverage_points.impact: Reduces penalties, preserves wealth, increases confidence

high_impact_leverage_points.name: Micro-investing point
high_impact_leverage_points.description: Enabling continued wealth building with small amounts
high_impact_leverage_points.impact: Maintains investment habits, continues wealth building

high_impact_leverage_points.name: Community support point
high_impact_leverage_points.description: Creating emotional support and shared learning
high_impact_leverage_points.impact: Reduces isolation, improves mental health, better decisions

high_impact_leverage_points.name: Job search integration point
high_impact_leverage_points.description: Connecting financial stability with job search success

high_impact_leverage_points.name: Re-employment transition point
high_impact_leverage_points.description: Maintaining financial discipline after getting new job
high_impact_leverage_points.impact: Prevents backsliding, maintains long-term wealth building

cascade_opportunities: 401K rollover guidance → reduces penalties → preserves more wealth → increases confidence → better overall decisions
Micro-investing → maintains investment habit → continued wealth building → better long-term outcomes
Community support → reduces isolation → better mental health → better financial decisions

root_causes_vs_symptoms.root_cause: Lack of specialized guidance for unemployment financial management

underlying_beliefs.current_belief: I need to cash out my 401K to survive
underlying_beliefs.alternative_belief: I can continue building wealth even while unemployed

underlying_beliefs.current_belief: Unemployed people can't afford financial advice
underlying_beliefs.alternative_belief: They need specialized guidance more than ever
401K can be a flexible financial tool

underlying_beliefs.current_belief: Financial stress is separate from job search
underlying_beliefs.alternative_belief: Financial stability improves job search success

system_optimization.currently_optimized_for: Short-term survival, traditional retirement planning, generic financial advice
system_optimization.stated_goals: Long-term wealth building, personalized guidance, comprehensive support

conflicting_mental_models: Traditional financial planning vs. crisis financial management
Short-term survival vs. long-term wealth building

recurring_cycles: Crisis → Panic → Poor Decisions → Worse Outcomes → More Crisis
Unemployment → Financial Stress → 401K Withdrawal → Reduced Future Wealth → Future Financial Stress
Job Loss → Isolation → Poor Mental Health → Poor Job Search → Longer Unemployment
Financial Guidance → Confidence → Better Decisions → Better Outcomes → More Trust in Guidance

system_archetypes.name: Limits to Growth
system_archetypes.description: App growth limited by temporary nature of unemployment

system_archetypes.name: Shifting the Burden
system_archetypes.description: Quick fixes (401K withdrawals) vs. fundamental solutions (continued investing)

system_archetypes.name: Success to the Successful
system_archetypes.description: Early users get better outcomes, creating competitive advantage

system_archetypes.name: Tragedy of the Commons
system_archetypes.description: Individual 401K withdrawals vs. collective retirement security

system_archetypes.name: Fixes that Fail
system_archetypes.description: Short-term financial relief vs. long-term wealth building

potential_interventions.name: 401K Rollover Guidance System
potential_interventions.description: Automated calculator showing optimal withdrawal strategies with tax implications
potential_interventions.system_impact: Reduces panic decisions → preserves wealth → increases confidence → better overall outcomes

potential_interventions.name: Micro-Investing Platform
potential_interventions.description: Enable continued investing with small amounts during unemployment
potential_interventions.system_impact: Maintains investment habits → continued wealth building → better long-term outcomes

potential_interventions.name: Community Support Network
potential_interventions.description: Connect users with similar experiences for emotional and practical support
potential_interventions.system_impact: Reduces isolation → better mental health → better financial decisions

potential_interventions.name: Job Search Financial Integration
potential_interventions.description: Connect financial stability with job search success
potential_interventions.system_impact: Faster re-employment → better financial stability → reduced need for 401K withdrawals

potential_interventions.name: Re-employment Transition Program
potential_interventions.description: Maintain financial discipline after getting new job
potential_interventions.system_impact: Prevents backsliding → maintains long-term wealth building → sustainable success

potential_interventions.name: AI Financial Coach
potential_interventions.description: Personalized guidance that adapts to unemployment context
potential_interventions.system_impact: Provides consistent, personalized support → better decisions → better outcomes

unintended_consequences: Users might become dependent on app → need clear transition plan
Community might create echo chamber → need diverse perspectives
AI guidance might be too generic → need personalization
Success might reduce urgency → need ongoing value proposition

gradual_introduction.interventions: Job search integration and AI coaching

living_system_dashboard.user_engagement_metrics: Daily active users, session duration, feature usage
living_system_dashboard.system_health_indicators: User satisfaction, retention rates, support ticket volume
living_system_dashboard.intervention_effectiveness: A/B test results, user feedback, outcome improvements

real_time_integrations: Job search APIs for employment status
technical_architecture.scalability_considerations: Handle crisis spikes during economic downturns

platform_approach.production: Bolt.new for advanced features and scaling
